title.narrative: 8.2 SECTOR PLANNING & COORDINATION

description.narrative: 8.2 Education authorities have the capacity to lead coordination and implementation of Education Sector Plans and budgets which address equity and quality for formal and non-formal education (in emergency and non-emergency contexts), which contributes to Equitable Access To Quality Education, Learning Outcomes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Programme Component Results (PCR) 8 Where a ministry of education is functional, government policies f or primary formal and non-formal education explicitly prioritise quality , child-centred education and lead to increased government allocations t o education.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 8.2 Education authorities have the capacity to lead coordination and implementation of Education Sector Plans and budgets whichaddress equity and quality for formal and non-formal education (in emergency and non-emergency contexts)
Costed sector and subsector plans in place with corresponding workplans implemented and monitored
Annual EMIS data reports and updated and disaggregated data available and inform sector plans
Updated school mapping available and used for sector planning
Percentage of female education personnel on the government payroll
